title: Types of Irony Quiz
description: Explore the different forms of irony used in literature and everyday life

questions.question: What type of irony occurs when the audience knows something a character does not?
A fire station burns down. What type of irony is this?
When someone says 'What lovely weather!' during a terrible storm, this is an example of:
In Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet, the audience knows Juliet is not truly dead, but Romeo does not. This is:
What is 'Socratic irony'?
options: Saying the opposite of what you believe
Pretending ignorance to expose the flaws in another's argument
A twist ending in a story

questions.question: A professional marriage counselor files for divorce. This best illustrates:
How does verbal irony differ from sarcasm?
options: Sarcasm is a form of verbal irony intended to mock or wound
They are exactly the same thing
Verbal irony is always humorous; sarcasm never is
Sarcasm is always written; verbal irony is spoken

questions.question: In 'The Gift of the Magi' by O. Henry, a wife sells her hair to buy a watch chain, while the husband sells his watch to buy hair combs. This is:
What is 'cosmic irony'?
options: When fate or the universe seems to conspire against a character

questions.question: A traffic safety instructor gets a speeding ticket. This is an example of:
What is 'structural irony'?
options: Irony in the physical structure of a building
When an author uses an unreliable narrator whose view the reader sees through
Irony that only appears in poetry
A single ironic statement in a story

questions.question: In a horror movie, the audience sees a monster behind a character who is oblivious. What type of irony creates the suspense?
Which statement is an example of verbal irony?
options: Saying 'I just love standing in long lines'
A pilot who is afraid of heights
A character unknowingly talking to their enemy

questions.question: In Sophocles' Oedipus Rex, Oedipus searches for the murderer of King Laius, not knowing he himself is the killer. This classic example represents:
options: Tragic irony (a form of dramatic irony)

questions.question: What is 'romantic irony' in literature?
options: Irony found only in romance novels
When two characters are ironically attracted to each other
When an author breaks the fictional illusion to remind readers the work is artificial
A love story with an unexpected ending
